conclusion: Analyze motion by comparing areas under velocity-time graphs.
Graph details: x-axis is time, y-axis is velocity. Particle A has a triangular profile, Particle B has a trapezoidal profile.
Calculate area under Particle A's graph: Area from 0 to t0 is v0 t0.
Calculate area under Particle A's graph: Area from t0 to 3t0 is 2v0 t0.
Total area under Particle A's graph is 3v0 t0.
Calculate area under Particle B's graph: Area from 0 to 3t0 is 1.5v0 t0.
Calculate area under Particle B's graph: Area from 3t0 to 6t0 is 1.5v0 t0.
Total area under Particle B's graph is 3v0 t0.
Both particles have the same total displacement of 3v0 t0 by 6t0.
Before 3t0, particle A is ahead; after 3t0, particle B catches up.
B catches up to A between 4t0 and 5t0; they meet at t = 5t0.
